intro: Tenoria nuda, commonly known as the naked tenoria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. Tenoria nuda is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny environments.
